sen.j: 竹崎 季長（たけさき すえなが、寛元4年（1246年） - 正和3年（1314年）頃）は、鎌倉時代中期における九州地方の御家人。
sen.e: Suenaga TAKESAKI (1246 - around 1314) was a gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate) of the Kyushu region who lived during the middle of the Kamakura Period.

sen.e: Suenaga is well known for his own picture scroll, "Moko Shurai Ekotoba" (picture scrolls on the Mongol invasion attempts against Japan) which he ordered to be drawn of his own distinguished war service.

sen.j: 肥後国竹崎郷（熊本県宇城市松橋町）の出身。
sen.e: Suenaga was born in Takesaki-go, Higo Province (present-day Matsubashi Town, Uki City, Kumamoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 菊池氏の一族であるが、同族内の所領争いに敗れて没落した。
sen.e: Although he was a member of the KIKUCHI clan, a territorial conflict among the family members brought him to ruin.

sen.j: このため、季長が持っていた所領は相当少なかったと言われている。
sen.e: Therefore, the territory he owned is said to be very small.

sen.j: 姉婿に鎌倉幕府政所を務める二階堂行忠の家人・三井資長がいる。
sen.e: His older sister was a wife of Sukenaga MITSUI, a retainer of Yukitada NIKAIDO who headed Mandokoro (the Administrative Board) of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 文永11年（1274年）、元 (王朝)（蒙古）の第一次侵攻である文永の役（元寇）では、博多において箱崎の少弐景資の軍に参陣し、息浜に陣した。
sen.e: In 1214 during the Bunei War (the first Mongolian attempt to invade Japan) of Genko (Mongol invasion attempt to Japan, consisting of two different wars) Suenaga joined the army of Kagesuke SHONI of Hakozaki, Hakata (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture), and had his corps based in Okinohama.

In 1274 during the Bunei War (the first attempted invasion by the Yuan Dynasty [Mongol]) of Genko (Mongol invasion attempt against Japan, consisting of two different wars) Suenaga joined the army of Kagesuke SHONI of Hakozaki, Hakata (present-day Fukuoka Prefecture), and had his corps based in Okinohama.
sen.cmt: 西暦を修正しました。"the Bunei War (the first Mongolian attempt to invade Japan)"部分、原文にある「元（王朝）」を入れた方が良いと思いますので、修正しました。

sen.j: 合戦では、景資の許しを得て5名の郎党とともに赤坂へ赴く。
sen.e: In the War, Suenaga went down to Akasaka with five other retainers with a permission from Kagesuke.

sen.j: 赤崎では既に菊池武房が蒙古兵を討ち取っていた。
sen.e: In Akasaka, Takefusa KIKUCHI already beaten Mongolian soldiers.
sen.cmt: 前文に「赤坂」とありますが、本文は「赤崎」となっています。（本文では、「赤崎」という地名はないようですので、「赤坂」と訳しています。）一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Akasaka, Takefusa KIKUCHI already had beaten Mongolian soldiers.
sen.cmt: "beaten"→"had beaten"に修正。「赤崎」は私も「赤坂」だと思います。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E8%8F%8A%E6%B1%A0%E6%AD%A6%E6%88%BF）
sen.e: In Akasaka, Takefusa KIKUCHI already had beaten Mongolian soldiers.

sen.j: しかし、武房は少弐氏の指揮下ではなく、季長は戦傷を負いながらも一番駆けの武功を立てた。
sen.e: However, as Takefusa was not working under command of SHONI, Suenaga was able to become the first soldier to attack the Mongolian soldiers among the SHONI corps as suffering war wounds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, as Takefusa was not working under the command of the Shoni clan, Suenaga was able to become the first soldier to attack the Mongolian soldiers among the Shoni corps though suffering war wounds.
sen.cmt: 「少弐氏」→"the Shoni clan"に修正。また、"SHONI"も頭文字のみ大文字。（用語統一リスト）"as suffering"→「負いながらも」なので、"though suffering"の方が良いと思います。
sen.e: However, as Takefusa was not working under the command of the Shoni clan, Suenaga was able to become the first soldier to attack the Mongolian soldiers among the Shoni corps though suffering war wounds.

sen.j: 文永の役は、暴風雨とも撤退とも言われる事情で蒙古軍が一夜にして博多湾から去り、終結する。
sen.e: The Bunei War ended overnight when the Mongolian army retreated from the Hakata bay due to a strong rain or its own strategic failure.

sen.j: 季長の武功は、負傷したのみであり、戦功とは認められなかった、あるいは事務的な手違いで報告されておらず、恩賞も与えられなかったと言われている。
sen.e: It is believed that the battle did not earn Suenaga any rewards for his service, either because what he had done in the War was not regarded as a distinguished war service (rather, it was considered that he merely received an injury in the war), or because his achievement was not reported to the feudal government due to a mishandling of an administrative procedure.

sen.j: 季長はこれを不服として、建治元年（1275年）6月にウマなどを処分して旅費を調達し、鎌倉へ赴いて幕府に直訴する。
sen.e: Being dissatisfied with the decision, Suenaga went to Kamakura by selling his horses to make money for the trip and filed a complaint directly to the feudal government in June 1275.

sen.j: 同年8月には奉行である安達泰盛との面会を果たし、恩賞地として肥後国海東郷の地頭に任じられた。
sen.e: He was finally allowed to meet with Yasumori ADACHI, a bugyo (magistrate), in August the same year, and appointed as Jito (the lord of a manor) of 海東郷, Higo Province.

sen.j: 弘安4年（1281年）、蒙古の第二次侵攻である弘安の役では、安達盛宗（泰盛の子）の指揮下において、志賀島や壱岐国の海戦で敵の軍船に斬り込む等の活躍をして軍功を挙げ、多大な恩賞を与えられた。
sen.e: In 1281 after the Koan War (the second Mongolian attempt to invade Japan), Suenaga was awarded a massive amount of compensations by cutting his way into enemy vessels in a naval battle in the Shikanoshima Island and Iki Province under the direction of Morimune ADACHI (a son of Yasumori).

sen.j: 戦後には元寇における自らの武功や鎌倉へ赴く事情などを中心に『蒙古襲来絵詞』（竹崎季長絵詞）を描かせ、甲佐神社へ奉納した。
sen.e: After the War, Suenaga ordered to draw "Moko Shurai Ekotoba" aka. "Takasaki Suenaga Ekotoba", in which his achievements and his trip to Kamakura were depicted, and he offered the picture scroll to Kosa-jinja Shrine.

sen.cmt: "War"は一般名詞なので頭文字を大文字にする必要はないと思います。"Suenaga ordered"以下の文は目的語が『蒙古襲来絵詞』になると思います。"Takasaki"→"Takesaki"に修正。

sen.j: このとき季長に恩賞の便宜を取り計らった安達泰盛や少弐景資らは、弘安8年（1285年）の霜月騒動で滅びており、恩義のある彼らへの鎮魂の意味があるとも指摘されている。
sen.e: It is also said that the picture scroll was drawn in order to pray for the repose of the souls of Yasumori ADACHI and Kagesuke SHONI who helped Suenaga to receive rewards but were killed in the Shimotsuki Incident (a coup to destroy Gokenin [immediate vassals of the shogunate] by Miuchibito [private vassals of the tokuso]) in 1285.
